resources.string: Blacklist: %1$d domains | Whitelist: %2$d domains and %3$d apps
Mobile data: %1$d apps | Wi-Fi data: %2$d apps | Custom: %3$d apps
%1$d permissions, %2$d services and %3$d receivers are disabled.
Adhell is not yet supported on your device.
To enable Adhell, you must activate Admin mode for this app. \nAdhell uses Knox APIs which require device administrator permission.
Adhell utilizes Knox SDK which requires ELM Development key. \nA developer license key needs to be renewed every 3 months.
Your device is not connected to the Internet.
Whitelist domains to bypass the firewall. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disable all features and uninstall Adhell
Do you really want to uninstall Adhell and enable all disabled apps?
Edit DNS only if you know the issues it can cause. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Blacklist domains or define firewall denial rules. \nToggle Domain rules to apply domain changes. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply firewall changes.

Firewall rule format: 
	packageName|ipAddress|port 
E.g. block port 53 for every IP in Chrome: 
	com.android.chrome|*|53
Domains support wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com \nDomain rule format for a specific app: \n\tpackageName|domain

This will enable all apps' permissions, services and receivers. 
Samsung Knox doesn't have an API to clear disabled components. 
Therefore, if they are still disabled after this operation, you need to uninstall Adhell to enable them. 

Do you really want to enable all apps' components?

Be careful when disabling system apps\' permissions, services and receivers. \nSamsung Knox doesn\'t have an API to clear disabled components. \nIf the database is corrupted, you cannot re-enable them and you need to do a factory reset.
Do you really want to apply or remove custom DNS for all apps? \nApplying custom DNS to all apps might cause your internet connection to malfunction.
Add the selected domain to your whitelist?
DNS addresses have been set. Toggle Domain rules to apply changes.
DNS has been restored to defaults. Toggle Domain rules to apply changes.
In addition to Adhell\'s standard package, you can add links to remote and local hosts lists. \nAdhell can block up to %1$d unique domains. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disabling system apps may cause the device to malfunction. \nIf app disabler toggle is enabled, changes take effect immediately.
Block or allow an app\'s mobile data usage. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply changes.
Block or allow an app\'s Wi-Fi data usage. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply changes.
Whitelist an app to bypass the firewall. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disable app components (permissions, services and receivers). \nIf app component toggle is enabled, changes take effect immediately.
Only protection level of \'dangerous\' can be disabled. \nDisabling a permission will also disable other permissions from the same group.

Disabling a service may crash the app. 
Once the service is disabled, it will be removed from the app. 
Samsung Knox doesn't have an API to list disabled services. 
Therefore, if the disabled services don't appear below, you need to reinstall the app.

Disabling a receiver may crash the app. 
Once the receiver is disabled, it will be removed from the app. 
Samsung Knox doesn't have an API to list disabled receivers. 
Therefore, if the disabled receivers don't appear below, you need to reinstall the app.
Backup all settings into a backup file in internal storage.
Restore all settings from a backup file. A \'storage\' permission needs to be granted.
Do you really want to enable all apps?
Do you really want to backup the database and replace any existing backup?
Do you really want to restore the database and replace your entire setup?
Set primary and secondary DNS. \nLeave it empty to restore to default.
Update host providers when enabling domain rules
Protect this app with a password
Enter the password to use this app
If you forget the password, you need to uninstall Adhell3.
Create logcat on internal storage for debugging purpose.
Show activation dialog to change the license key.
